0.title: College
0.content: I attended a partnership course that offered me the opportunity to learn and work. Hardware and repair focussed. Mainly repairing various laptop brands and Samsung phones.

1.title: Apprenticeship
1.content: After a lot of hard work and late nights I graduated college with the highest possible grade. Having won apprentice of the year during the partnership scheme, I decided to stay on with the repair company. My spare time slowly began being taken over by an old interest though...

2.title: Junior Software Developer
2.content: Spurred on by a want to learn something new, I applied for a junior position working within a small team that were creating a bespoke CMS platform. Wide-eyed and naive, I got the job.

3.title: Software Developer
3.content: After just eight short months, I was promoted into a software developer position. My incredible teachers and craving for new technologies excelled me past anything I could've thought possible at the time.

4.title: Present Day
4.content: A year and a half working within this team and my knowledge seems to be growing exponentially. But my understanding of programming and the software world barely even scratches the surface. I continue to teach myself about new concepts, methodologies and patterns, both in and out of the workplace. Vue is one of the most recent examples.
